abilities.name: Storm, Earth, Fire

abilities.name: Aspect of Death

Other defensive damage modifiers may stack.Deathwing does not heal while in the Hall of Storms or after casting Hearthstone.Deathwing can heal himself by using Dragonflight, benefiting from Regeneration Globes, using Healing Fountains, and by selecting certain talents.

abilities.name: Ultimate Evolution
abilities.description: Clone target allied Hero and control it for 20 seconds. Abathur has perfected the clone, granting it 20% Spell Power, 20% bonus Attack Damage, and 10% bonus Movement Speed. Cannot use their Heroic Ability.Type: SummonAffects: Allied HeroesTargeting: Unit targetProperties: Channeled cast (stationary), StasisCast time: 1 + 0.0625 secondsRange: GlobalInterrupting the Ability puts it on a 10 second cooldown.The target of Ultimate Evolution must be a real Hero; other Heroic Targets, like Heroic Pets and Vehicles, cannot be cloned.Upon successfully casting Ultimate Evolution, Abathur is put in Stasis for its duration. In addition to usual effects of Stasis, Abathur is removed from ground plane (disjoints certain projectiles), has no collision, cannot regenerate Health, Mana, Energy or Shields and cannot be seen on the minimap or revealed.Abathur returns to the same location where he cast Ultimate Evolution once it ends.Ultimate Evolution CloneType: HallucinationScaling: -Targeting: Direct controlHealth: 100%Damage: 120%Attack speed: 100%Attack range: 100%Movement Speed: 110%Sight radius: 100%Ultimate Evolution Clone is untalented and does not inherit any progress on baseline quests.It is possible to complete baseline quests on the Clone, but any progress and rewards are reset for the next cast.Clone does not gain Ability effects that are unlocked by reaching a certain level, such as Muradin's Storm Bolt pierce.Clone can Mount, use the Healing Fountain and can benefit from, but not directly collect, Regeneration Globes.The Clone can fake channeling Objectives, but it cannot complete the channel to capture the Objective.Some of the Clone's Summons, including Lunara's Wisps, and Nova's Holo Decoys do not expire when the Clone expires or is destroyed. However, Misha and Samuro's Images, Probius Pylons, and Junkrat Mines and Traps exceptionally do expire.There are some limitations and exceptions to cloning certain Heroes:- Deathwing cannot be cloned due to his Trait.- Cloning Cho'gall only grants access to Cho's Abilities.- Cloning a Viking only clones the specific Viking targeted.- D.Va's clone can only use the form she was cloned from. Pilot D.Va's Call Mech is disabled, and activating Self-Destruct in Mech mode immediately returns control to Abathur, leaving the exploding Mech on the Battleground. Additionally, if Ultimate Evolution expires during this time, the Mech will instantly explode as it does.- Kharazim's level 1 Talent is inherited, as it is his Trait, with Insight completed if that Talent was selected.- Murky's Trait, Spawn Egg, is disabled.- Alexstrasza's and Ragnaros's Traits start on full cooldown every time they are copied, making it impossible to use Molten Core and Dragonqueen during the clone's lifetime.- The effects of Jaina's Frostbite, Malthael's Reaper's Mark, Murky's Slime, Sylvanas's Banshee's Curse, Tassadar's Psionic Storm, and Zagara's Creep Tumor do not stack and are instead shared, benefiting both the clone and the cloned Hero regardless of who applied the effect.- Qhira and her Clone can both apply their own instance of Bleed from Blood Rage. However, only the unit who placed the first Bleed stack on the unit may activate Blood Rage on it. Additionally, the stack count and duration are shared among all Bleeds on the target, allowing both Qhira and Abathur to instantly gain the current stack count on the target and increment and extend each other's Bleed stacks on the target. Bleeds placed by the Clone also remain even after when the Clone has expired.- Both Probius and his Ultimate Evolution Clone can fully interact with each other's Pylons and Warp Rifts.- On death effects that change a Heroes state, such as the traits of Uther, Tyrael, and Leoric, are not inherited by the Clone. Other post-death events, such as Junkrat's Total Mayhem, are inherited.The Clone grants no XP or Takedown credit on death.The Clone's Summons do not benefit from this Ability's Spell Power bonus.Attack Damage and Spell Power bonuses stack additively with offensive damage modifiers and healing dealt modifiers.
